Title: The Subtle Female ｜ Tao Te Ching Explained ｜ Chapter 6

Content.Knowledge Point: The valley spirit represents the Tao and its endless potential.
Content.Text: The valley spirit never dies. It is named the mysterious female, and the doorway of the mysterious female is the base from which heaven and earth spring.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao Te Ching values traditionally feminine characteristics.
Content.Text: All throughout the Tao Te Ching, the traditional characteristics of the female, i.e. submissiveness, humility, quietness, generosity, etc., are applauded and endorsed.

Content.Knowledge Point: Lao Tzu encourages both men and women to cultivate certain human characteristics.
Content.Text: Lao Tzu was not putting one sex above another. Rather, he was encouraging both men and women to cultivate in themselves certain human characteristics above others.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao is often described in terms of undervalued human qualities.
Content.Text: The Tao is often described in terms of these traits.

Content.Knowledge Point: The discussion of gender should be approached with kindness and understanding.
Content.Text: So what do you think this means for us? I understand that whenever we talk about things like gender, there is a potential for things to get political.
